New Records: Ruben Trumpelmann became the first player in T20I history to take two wickets with the first two balls of a match.
Key Match Events: Namibia clinched a thrilling Super Over win against Oman to kick off their T20 World Cup campaign.
Ruben Trumpelmann's historic feat of two wickets in two balls set the stage for Namibia's disciplined bowling display.
Jan Frylinck anchored the innings with a steady 45 off 48 balls.
Mehran Khan's exceptional bowling (3/7) kept the pressure on Namibia.
Namibia's Gerhard Erasmus and David Wiese took charge in the Super Over, smashing 21 runs.
Oman's response in the Super Over fell short as they managed only 10 runs, securing Namibia's victory.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was the second Super Over in T20 World Cup history, following the first-ever between New Zealand and Sri Lanka in Kandy in 2012.
